data.title: Twitter shares drop 21 percent on slowed ad spending, tech glitch
data.text: Twitter shares plummeted more than 21 percent Thursday after the social network posted worse-than-expected quarterly results driven in part by an ongoing tech glitch that has been hindering its ability to target users with ads. Twitter said it has been having problems implementing a feature that was supposed to ask permission to share user data.

data.title: Twitter's problems aren't permanent: Pivotal Research's Levine
data.text: Twitter shares are tanking after reporting earnings. Michael Levine of Pivotal Research joins CNBC's "Power Lunch" team and Julia Boorstin to discuss what happened and what investors should do.

data.title: Twitter shares plunge on weak revenue numbers
data.text: Twitter posted worse-than-expected third quarter revenue and profit on Thursday, which the company attributed to advertising problems including product bugs and unusually low demand over the summer, sending its shares down more than 15 percent. Shares of the micro-blogging platform dropped to $33 in trading before the bell.

data.title: Twitter Stock Plunges Up To 20% After Missing On Earnings
data.text: Twitter shares took a hit from weak third quarter earnings.

data.title: Twitter Nosedives On Mixed Q3 Print; Monetizable Daily Active Users Rise 17% Year-Over-Year
data.text: Twitter, Inc. (NYSE: TWTR) reported third-quarter earnings of 5 cents per share Thursday against a 2-cent Street estimate and sales of $823.717 million that missed the Street estimate of $874.06 million.

data.title: Twitter (TWTR) Misses Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
data.text: Twitter (TWTR) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -15.00% and -6.00%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2019. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

data.title: Twitter CEO Dorsey Runs Out of Excuses
data.text: Twitter Inc. (NYSE: TWTR) posted one of its occasionally horrible quarters, which is either proof that its business model was always hopelessly flawed or that CEO Jack Dorsey is out of excuses for the deeply harmful stumbles of his four-year tenure.

data.title: Twitter Ad Tech Glitch Hammers Q3 Results, Sending Investors To Sidelines
data.text: Twitter said it reached 145 million monetizable daily active users in the third quarter, up 17% from the same period a year ago. But the company badly undershot Wall Street expectations due to technical glitches in its advertising technology. Total revenue of $824 million rose 9% over the 2018 period, but fell well short of

data.title: Twitter's stock plummets as sales badly miss expectations
data.text: Twitter's once-hot stock is cratering in premarket trading after the company added plenty of new users but struggled to sell advertising to market to them.

data.title: Earnings Results: Twitter stock tumbles 20% after company says advertising bugs weighing on earnings
data.text: Twitter Inc. shares were tanking in premarket trading Thursday after bugs in the company’s advertising platform led to misses across the board on its financial metrics, even as user growth proved more rapid than expected.

data.title: Twitter Q3 misses big on revenues of $824M and EPS of $0.05 on the back of adtech glitches
data.text: Twitter today reported its earnings for the quarter that ended September 30, and the numbers delivered a big surprise, falling on both sales and earnings per share. Revenues came in at $824 million, and EPS at $0.05.
